questions.question_hindi: निम्नलिखित में से कौन साबंदरगाहसंगम युगमें नहीं था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following was not a port during the Sangam period?
questions.explanation_english: The Sangam period (3rd century BCE to 3rd century CE) was marked by the prominence of Tamil kingdoms like the Cheras, Cholas, and Pandyas. Korkai and Alangulam were major ports during this era. Urayur was a significant capital of the Chera dynasty. Erichamadu, however, emerged as a port later, during the Pallava-Chola period, and is not associated with the Sangam era.
questions.explanation_hindi: संगम युग (ईसा पूर्व 3 वीं शताब्दी से ईसा में 3 वीं शताब्दी) में चेरा, चोल और पांड्य जैसे तमिल राज्यों का प्रभुत्व रहा। कोरकै और अलंगुलम इस युग के प्रमुख बंदरगाह थे। उरैयूर चेर राजवंश की महत्वपूर्ण राजधानी थी। एरिकमेडु बाद में, पल्लव-चोल युग में एक बंदरगाह के रूप में उभरा था और संगम युग से जुड़ा नहीं है।
key_facts: Korkai and Alangulam were prominent ports during the Sangam period.
Erichamadu became a port during the Pallava-Chola era, not the Sangam period.

questions.question_hindi: कश्मीरका वह कौन-सा शासक था जोसाहित्यएवंकलाका पोषक था। उसके दरबार में क्षीरभट्ट, उद्भट्ट एवं दामोदर भट्ट आदि विद्वान रहते थे?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which ruler of Kashmir was a patron of literature and the arts? Scholars such as Kshirabhatta, Udbhata, and Damodar Bhatta were present in his court?
questions.explanation_english: Lalitaditya Muktapida was a prominent ruler of the Karkota dynasty in Kashmir during the 8th century. He is renowned for his patronage of literature, art, and architecture. His court was adorned by scholars like Kshirabhatta, Udbhata, and Damodar Bhatta, who contributed significantly to Sanskrit literature and philosophy. The other options are either less historically documented or unrelated to Kashmir's cultural history.
questions.explanation_hindi: ललितादित्य मुक्तापीड कर्कोटक वंश के कश्मीर के प्रमुख शासक थे जो 8वीं शताब्दी में शासन करते थे। वे साहित्य, कला और वास्तुकला के प्रमुख संरक्षक थे। उनके दरबार में क्षीरभट्ट, उद्भट्ट और दामोदर भट्ट जैसे विद्वान उपस्थित रहे, जिन्होंने संस्कृत साहित्य और दर्शनशास्त्र में महत्वपूर्ण योगदान दिया। अन्य विकल्प ऐतिहासिक रूप से कम दस्तावेजित हैं या कश्मीर के सांस्कृतिक इतिहास से संबंधित नहीं हैं।
questions.topic: Medieval Indian History - Kashmir Rulers and Cultural Contributions
key_facts: Lalitaditya Muktapida was a 8th-century ruler of the Karkota dynasty in Kashmir.
His court included scholars like Kshirabhatta, Udbhata, and Damodar Bhatta, who contributed to Sanskrit literature and philosophy.

questions.question_hindi: पालोंके प्रशासन के अंतर्गत 'चौरोद-धरणीका' नामक पदाधिकारी निम्न में से किससे संबंधित थे?
options_hindi: पुलिस पदाधिकारीजो चोरों पर निगाह रखते थे।
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Under the administration of the Palas, the officer known as 'Chouroud-dharani-ka' was related to which of the following?
options_english: Police officers who kept watch on thieves.
questions.explanation_english: The term 'Chouroud-dharani-ka' in the Pala administration refers to an official responsible for dealing with thieves. The word 'Chour' means thief, and 'Dharani' implies a holder or manager. Thus, this officer was likely a law enforcement figure tasked with overseeing anti-theft measures. While the exact role might not align perfectly with modern police roles, the closest match among the options is a police officer. Options B and C are incorrect as they refer to a group of thieves or an intelligence head, which are not supported by historical records. Option D is invalid because option A is accurate.
questions.explanation_hindi: पाल शासन में 'चौरोद-धरणीका' शब्द चोरी के मामलों के प्रबंधन के लिए जिम्मेदार एक अधिकारी को संदर्भित करता है। 'चौर' चोर का अर्थ है और 'धरणी' धारक या प्रबंधक का अर्थ है। इसलिए, यह अधिकारी चोरी रोकने के उपायों के लिए जिम्मेदार था। विकल्प B और C गलत हैं क्योंकि वे चोरों के समूह या गुप्तचर विभाग के प्रमुख को संदर्भित करते हैं, जो ऐतिहासिक रूप से समर्थित नहीं हैं। विकल्प D अवैध है क्योंकि विकल्प A सही है।
key_facts: The Pala dynasty (8th–12th century CE) had a structured administrative system with specialized officials.
The term 'Chouroud-dharani-ka' is derived from 'Chour' (thief) and 'Dharani' (holder/manager), indicating a law enforcement role.

questions.question_hindi: निम्नलिखित में से किस लेखक नेविजयनगर साम्राज्यका समकालीन विवरण लिखा है?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which of the following authors wrote a contemporary account of the Vijayanagar Empire?
questions.explanation_english: Domingo Paes, a Portuguese traveler, visited the Vijayanagar Empire in the early 16th century and documented its political, social, and economic conditions. His account is one of the most detailed contemporary descriptions of the empire. Shams Siraj Afif wrote about the Bahmani Sultanate, which was a rival of Vijayanagar but not a direct contemporary account. Linschoten's works focused on trade routes, and Pietro Della Valle's account came later, after the empire's decline.
questions.explanation_hindi: डोमिंगो पायस, एक पुर्तगाली यात्री, विजयनगर साम्राज्य के शुरुआती 16वीं शताब्दी में आए और इसकी राजनीतिक, सामाजिक और आर्थिक स्थिति का विवरण दर्ज किया। उनका विवरण साम्राज्य के बारे में सबसे विस्तृत समकालीन विवरण है। शम्स सिराज अफ़ीफ़ ने बहमनी सुल्तानत के बारे में लिखा, जो विजयनगर का प्रतिद्वंद्वी था लेकिन सीधा समकालीन विवरण नहीं है। लिंसशोटेन के कार्य व्यापार मार्गों पर केंद्रित थे, और पीट्रो डेल्ला बल्ले का विवरण साम्राज्य के अवनमन के बाद आया।
key_facts: Domingo Paes provided a detailed contemporary account of the Vijayanagar Empire in the 16th century.
Shams Siraj Afif wrote about the Bahmani Sultanate, a rival of Vijayanagar, but not a direct contemporary account.

questions.question_hindi: विजयनगर राज्यमें निम्नलिखित में से किसका सामाजिक स्तर अन्य तीन से अधिक ऊँचा था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: In the Vijayanagar Empire, which of the following had a higher social status than the other three?
questions.explanation_english: In the Vijayanagar Empire, the social hierarchy among artisans was influenced by the caste system. Potters (Kumbhakars) were generally considered to hold a higher status compared to blacksmiths (Lohars) and leather workers (Charmkars) due to the essential role of pottery in daily life and religious rituals. Weavers (Bunakars) were also respected but typically ranked lower than potters in this hierarchy. Blacksmiths and leather workers were often placed at the lower end due to the physical nature of their work and association with impurity in some contexts.
questions.explanation_hindi: विजयनगर राज्य में कुम्भकार (मिट्टी के बर्तन बनाने वाले) का सामाजिक स्तर अन्य श्रमिकों की तुलना में अधिक ऊँचा माना जाता था। बुनकर, लुहार और चर्मकार के काम भौतिक और अशुद्ध रूप में देखे जाते थे, जबकि कुम्भकार के काम दैनिक जीवन और धार्मिक अनुष्ठानों में आवश्यक थे। इसलिए कुम्भकार के सामाजिक स्तर को अधिक महत्व दिया गया।
questions.topic: Social Structure of the Vijayanagar Empire
key_facts: Potters (Kumbhakars) were considered higher in the social hierarchy due to their role in daily life and religious rituals.
Blacksmiths and leather workers were often placed at the lower end of the hierarchy due to the physical nature of their work.
